newsitem.title: USA: Helicopter crashes in New York City river.
newsitem.headline: Helicopter crashes in New York City river.

text.p: A helicopter crashed Tuesday afternoon into the East River in New York City, and all four people on board were injured, authorities said.

Two victims suffered cardiac arrest and were in extremely critical condition, a spokesman for the New York City Fire Department said. They were taken to nearby New York Hospital, and there was no immediate information on their identities.
Two others, both men, were listed in stable condition, one at New York Hospital and one at Metropolitan Hospital, the Fire Department said.
The accident involved a large corporate helicopter carrying a pilot, a co-pilot and two passengers, police said.

The two passengers were employees of Colgate-Palmolive Co., the household products company, said Bob Murray, a company spokesman. They were traveling from the company's research and development office in Piscataway, New Jersey, he said.
Police said the helicopter had just droppped off two passengers at the 60th Street Heliport and was taking off again for White Plains, New York, when the accident occurred.
All four victims were pulled from the water, the Fire Department said.
Also, an emergency medical technician who jumped in the river to rescue them was treated for exposure, authorities said.
The report of the crash came in at 5:36 p.m. EDT, the Fire Department said. The crash occurred under clear sunny skies.
Witnesses said the helicopter remained submerged below the water's surface.
